summary: v2.0 A Python script for Blender 2.49b: given Mesh_0 and Mesh_1 it returns Mesh_0.5, or other sizes. Sizes between 0.0 and 1.0 fit the Skyrim slider, but sizes higher than 1 (larger than Mesh_1)  or smaller than 1 (thinner than Mesh_0) are now possible with version 2.0.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3][b]Mesh_0.5 Blenderscript[/b]
 

[b]What is it?[/b]
A simple Python script for Blender 2.49b, given Mesh_0 and Mesh_1 it returns Mesh_0.5 or other sizes.
 

[b]Why it shouldbe useful?[/b]
Mesh_0.5 is useful for:
[/size][list]
[*][size=3]NEW v2 - modding purposes (e.g. enlarge a bit here or there Mesh_1 or reduce Mesh_0 or any combination)[/size]
[*][size=3]it is interesting to have the intermediate mesh that will appear in game directly inside Blender allowing to adjust Mesh_1 and Mesh_0 if needed (the script is really fast),[/size]
[*][size=3]check the mesh compatibility (see below "Mesh incompatibility issue"),[/size]
[/list][size=3] 

[b]The mesh incompatibility issue[/b]
For speed issues, Skyrim needs Mesh_1 and Mesh_0 with the same vertex order stored in the
vertex list inside the nif file. Differences in the order will aberrant shapes
in game (other differences may even bring to CTDs).
By making Mesh 0.5 you will check in a fast way if the ordering is correct, if not you
will see an aberrant shape (figure 2). In this case apply the script "Mesh_1 to Mesh_0"
(www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79572/).
[/size][list=1]
[size=3]

[/size][/list][size=3]  [b]Other scripts[/b]
- [b]Mesh_0 Generator[/b] Blender script - http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80506/?
  Given Body_1, Body_0 and Dress/Armor_1 gives mesh Dress/Armor_0.
- [b]Mesh X Mirror for Modders[/b] Blender script - http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/80503/?
  Given a "half" Dress/Armor mesh it mirrors: verts positions, bone weights, and UV map of the selected faces.
- [b]Mesh_0.5 [/b]Blender script - http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79663/?
  Given Mesh_1 and Mesh_0 and a scaling factor (say 0.5) it will return the weighed mesh. Negative scaling gives thinner 
  than Mesh_0, larger than 1 gives a mesh larger than Mesh_1
- [b]Mesh_1 to Mesh_0 Blender compatibility script[/b] - http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/79572/?
  This solvs the mesh incompatibility issue (i.e. congruence in the order the vertices are stored in the file).
  So you can part and join the meshes and fix the order once you have done.


[b]What does this script do?[/b]
This script builds a copy of Mesh_1 (say Mesh_1_new) and (with Size Factor 0.5) it moves the vertices on the half 
distance between the node position in Mesh_1 and Mesh_0. Just like the way Skirim does, the script uses the vertex order.
If some ordering issue is present the out coming mesh will be a mess (see figure 2).
 
 
[b]How can I use it?[/b]
It is strightforword:
[/size][list=1]
[*][size=3]in object mode unselect all,[/size]
[*][size=3]right-clickon Mesh_1 and then 1 and SHIFT-Right-Click-Select the Mesh_0 (the first selected will be duplicated),[/size]
[*][size=3]than goto the tab: "Object > Scripts > Mesh_0.5" and click it.[/size]
[*][size=3]choose the Size Factor (0.5 is the default)[/size]
[*][size=3]you can choose if apply the reshape only to selected verts in Mesh_1 (or Mesh_0)[/size]
[*][size=3]DONE[/size]
[/list][size=3]
 
[b]How to install the script[/b]
Downloadthe file, unzip and drop it in the folder:
"C:\Program Files (x86)\BlenderFoundation\Blender\.blender\scripts", or wherever you have the Blender script
folder. Then run Blender and it will recognize the script automatically.
 

[b]Documentation and software[/b]
[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Introductionto Python (http://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/ex24.html)[/size]
[*][size=3]Python 2.7functions (https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html)[/size]
[*][size=3]Blenderfunctions for Python scripting (https://www.blender.org/api/249PythonDoc)[/size]
[*][size=3]Notepad++(https://notepad-plus-plus.org/)[/size]
[*][size=3]Blender2.49b[/size]
[*][size=3]Python 2.7[/size]
[/list][size=3] 

[b]Bugs and requests[/b]
Read carefully the instructions and PM me if something goes wrong. But the script is
that simple that issues will hardly arise.
 

[b]Permission[/b]
Please, do not upload this script on other sites without permission (other Nexus sites are not "another site", but refer to this page).
[/size]
